title: Interior Ministry Briefs Standing Committee on National Security, Counter-Terrorism and Border Security
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 22 (APP):The Ministry of Interior and its attached departments on Monday briefed the National Assembly’s Standing Committee on their roles, responsibilities and achievements in ensuring national security, counter-terrorism and border security.
The committee commended the sacrifices made by the civil armed forces and assured full cooperation to enhance the ministry’s working.”
The secretary of the Ministry of Interior Khuram Ali Agha informed the committee about the ministry’s mission, vision, organizational structure and its role in maintaining internal security, securing foreigners, and implementing immigration and asylum policies.
Representatives from the civil armed forces nationwide also briefed the committee on their areas of responsibility, resources, capabilities, deployments and achievements in counter-terrorism, anti-smuggling drives and border security. The committee commended the sacrifices made by the civil armed forces in ensuring border security, conducting counter-terrorism operations, preventing smuggling and protecting critical installations.
Heads and representatives of attached departments, including the Capital Development Authority (CDA), Islamabad Police, Federal Investigation Agency (FIA), Passport and Visa, National Database and Registration Authority (NADRA), National Electronic Crime Taskforce (NECTA), Financial Action Task Force (FATF), Civil Defence, National Police Bureau (NPB), and National Academy of Prisons Administration, also briefed the committee on their organizational structure, functions, and achievements.
The committee assured the ministry of its full cooperation in enhancing its working, prioritizing the country’s best interests above party lines. In return, the committee expected similar cooperation and professional input from the ministry and its departments.
The briefing was attended by honorable members of the National Assembly, senior officers from the Ministry of Interior, and representatives from the civil armed forces and attached departments.
